tweets.text:
So what has @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, the water industry and cheating got to do with a Sex Pistols gig on the 14th Jan 1978 in San Francisco?

You're going to have to tune in tomorrow night to find out.

You know it makes sense.

https://t.co/JPSyolWS2R

We've completed the installation of 'property flood resilience' (PFR) products at the first house that opted in as part of the York Flood Alleviation Scheme. It's the first installation of 54 properties in the New Walk 'flood cell'.  Eligible properties can get PFR up to ¬£7,500. https://t.co/t87VKd9dgQ

@connectNLWA @GeorgeMonbiot @kilnerevonnet @EnvAgency @StopTheRebuild @XREnfield @XRLondon @xr_rebelradio Interesting. So you investigated yourself using scientific services you paid for after the actual event took place. How this was undertaken? Was the exact same water sample retested? Any chance of interferance? Like magic, the problem disappears

@georgiaes @GeorgeMonbiot @kilnerevonnet @EnvAgency @StopTheRebuild @XREnfield @XRLondon @xr_rebelradio This was investigated carefully. The data was reported in error & the correct figure was 0.01 ug/l which was validated by Marchwood Scientific Services & reported to the Environment Agency.  No breach of limits has taken place & we are proud of the current plant's performance.

@paulpowlesland Hello, Paul... Two different issues, really... Weed build-up is not caused by sewage... We are very careful about retaining any habitats while carrying out necessary work... Too much weed disables our riverside monitoring equipment... Thanks for getting in touch... Peter
